questions.question: If p represents radiation pressure, C represents the speed of light and q represents radiation energy striking a unit area per second, then non-zero integers a, b and C are such that PaqbCc is dimensionless, then..
questions.option1: a = 1, b = 1, c = -1
questions.option2: a = 1, b = -1, c = 1
questions.option3: a = -1, b = 1,c = 1
questions.option4: a = 1,b = 1,c = 1
questions.description:
Solution: Here, [M0L0T0] 


Comparing powers of M, L and T, we get
a + b = 0, -a + c = 0, -2a - 3b = 0
Solving a = 1, b = -1, c = 1

questions.question: A plate has a length (5 ± 0.1) cm and breadth (2 ± 0.01) cm. Then the area of the plate is....
questions.option1: (10 ± 0.25) cm2
questions.option2: (10 ± 0.01) cm2
questions.option3: (10 ± 0.001) cm2
questions.option4: (10 ± 1) cm2
questions.description:
Solution: A = ab



ΔA = 0.025 × A = 0.25cm2

questions.question: Suppose a quantity can be dimensionally represented in terms M, L and T, that is [y] = [Ma Lb Tc]. The quantity mass......
questions.option1: may be represented in terms of L, T and y if a = 0
questions.option2: may be represented in terms of L, T and y if a ≠ 0
questions.option3: Can always be dimensionally represented in terms of L, T and y
questions.option4: Can never be dimensionally represented in terms of L, T and y
questions.description:
Solution: M = y1/a, L-b/a, T-c/a
Where a should not be zero.

questions.question: A student performs an experiment to determine young's modulus of a wire, exactly 2 m long, by searle's method. In a particular reading, the student measures the extension in the length of the wire to be 0.8 mm with an uncertainty of ± 0.05 mm at a load of exactly 1.0 kg. The student also measures the diameter of the wire to be 0.4 mm with an uncertainty of ± 0.01 mm. The young's modulus obtained from the reading is [Take g = 9.8 ms-2]
questions.option1: (2.0 ± 0.3) × 1011 Nm-2
questions.option2: (2.0 ± 0.2) × 1011 Nm-2
questions.option3: (2.0 ± 0.1) × 1011 Nm-2
questions.option4: (2.0 ± 0.05) × 1011 Nm-2
questions.description:
Solution:  

= 2.0 × 1011 Nm-2



= 0.2 × 1011 Nm-2
or (Y + ΔY) = (2 + 0.2) × 1011 Nm-2

questions.question: If the length of rod A is (3.25 ± 0.01) cm and that of B is (4.19 ± 0.01) cm, then the rod B is longer than rod A by....
questions.option1: (0.94 ± 0.00) cm
questions.option2: (0.94 ± 0.01) cm
questions.option3: (0.94 ± 0.02) cm
questions.option4: (0.94 ± 0.005) cm
questions.description:
Solution: Given, length of rod A is LA = 3.25 ± 0.01
Of B is LB = 4.19 ± 0.01
Then, the rod B is longer than rod A by a length
Δl = LB - LA
Δl = (4.19 ± 0.01) - (3.25 ± 0.01)
Δl = (0.94 ± 0.02) cm

questions.question:
k = Boltzmann constant, t = temperature, x = distance
The dimensions of β is.......
questions.option1: [M L T-4]
questions.option2: [M-2 L-2 T4]
questions.option3: [M L T-2]
questions.option4: [M2 L T-1]
questions.description:
Solution:  

α = [M -1L-1 T-2]
[M L T-2] = [M -1L-1 T2] [β]-1
β = [M-2 L-2 T4]

questions.question: Identify the pair whose dimensions are equal.
questions.option1: torque and work
questions.option2: stress and energy
questions.option3: force and stress
questions.option4: force and work
questions.description:
Solution: Force = [MLT-2]
Work = [ML2T-2]
Stress = [ML-1T-2]
Energy = [ML2T-2]
Torque = [ML2T-2]

questions.question: The length of an object is measured using a vernier system whose main scale is 30 cm long with 600 divisions. If 19 divisions of the main scale coincide with 20 divisions of the vernier scale, then its least count is.....
questions.option1: 0.25 cm
questions.option2: 0.025 cm
questions.option3: 0.35 cm
questions.option4: 0.025 mm
questions.description:
Solution: Because Least count = MSD - VSD



... Least count = (5 - 4.75) × 10-4 = 0.025 mm

questions.question: What is the unit of angular acceleration in SI system?
questions.option1: N kg-1
questions.option2: m s-2
questions.option3: rad s-2
questions.option4: m kg-1 K
questions.description:
Solution: From the formula of angular acceleration we know that

Putting the appropiate units we get

questions.question: Dimensional formula of magnetic flux is.....
questions.option1: [ML2 T-2 A-1]
questions.option2: [ML0 T-2 A-2]
questions.option3: [M0 L-2 T-2 A-3]
questions.option4: [ML2 T-2 A3]
questions.description:
Solution:  
= [ML2 T-2 A-1]

questions.option1: a = 1, b = 1, c = -1

a + b = 0, -a + c = 0, -2a - 3b = 0
Solving a = 1, b = -1, c = 1

questions.question: A plate has a length (5 ± 0.1) cm and breadth (2 ± 0.01) cm. Then the area of the plate is....
questions.option1: (10 ± 0.25) cm2
questions.option2: (10 ± 0.01) cm2
questions.option3: (10 ± 0.001) cm2
questions.option4: (10 ± 1) cm2
questions.description:
Solution: A = ab



ΔA = 0.025 × A = 0.25cm2

questions.question: Suppose a quantity can be dimensionally represented in terms M, L and T, that is [y] = [Ma Lb Tc]. The quantity mass......
questions.option1: may be represented in terms of L, T and y if a = 0
questions.option2: may be represented in terms of L, T and y if a ≠ 0
questions.option3: Can always be dimensionally represented in terms of L, T and y
questions.option4: Can never be dimensionally represented in terms of L, T and y
questions.description:
Solution: M = y1/a, L-b/a, T-c/a
Where a should not be zero.

questions.question: A student performs an experiment to determine young's modulus of a wire, exactly 2 m long, by searle's method. In a particular reading, the student measures the extension in the length of the wire to be 0.8 mm with an uncertainty of ± 0.05 mm at a load of exactly 1.0 kg. The student also measures the diameter of the wire to be 0.4 mm with an uncertainty of ± 0.01 mm. The young's modulus obtained from the reading is [Take g = 9.8 ms-2]
questions.option1: (2.0 ± 0.3) × 1011 Nm-2
questions.option2: (2.0 ± 0.2) × 1011 Nm-2
questions.option3: (2.0 ± 0.1) × 1011 Nm-2
questions.option4: (2.0 ± 0.05) × 1011 Nm-2
questions.description:
Solution:  

= 2.0 × 1011 Nm-2



= 0.2 × 1011 Nm-2
or (Y + ΔY) = (2 + 0.2) × 1011 Nm-2

questions.question: If the length of rod A is (3.25 ± 0.01) cm and that of B is (4.19 ± 0.01) cm, then the rod B is longer than rod A by....
questions.option1: (0.94 ± 0.00) cm
questions.option2: (0.94 ± 0.01) cm
questions.option3: (0.94 ± 0.02) cm
questions.option4: (0.94 ± 0.005) cm
questions.description:
Solution: Given, length of rod A is LA = 3.25 ± 0.01
Of B is LB = 4.19 ± 0.01
Then, the rod B is longer than rod A by a length
Δl = LB - LA
Δl = (4.19 ± 0.01) - (3.25 ± 0.01)
Δl = (0.94 ± 0.02) cm

questions.question:
k = Boltzmann constant, t = temperature, x = distance
The dimensions of β is.......
questions.option1: [M L T-4]
questions.option2: [M-2 L-2 T4]
questions.option3: [M L T-2]
questions.option4: [M2 L T-1]
questions.description:
Solution:  

α = [M -1L-1 T-2]
[M L T-2] = [M -1L-1 T2] [β]-1
β = [M-2 L-2 T4]

questions.question: Identify the pair whose dimensions are equal.
questions.option1: torque and work
questions.option2: stress and energy
questions.option3: force and stress
questions.option4: force and work
questions.description:
Solution: Force = [MLT-2]
Work = [ML2T-2]
Stress = [ML-1T-2]
Energy = [ML2T-2]
Torque = [ML2T-2]

questions.question: The length of an object is measured using a vernier system whose main scale is 30 cm long with 600 divisions. If 19 divisions of the main scale coincide with 20 divisions of the vernier scale, then its least count is.....
questions.option1: 0.25 cm
questions.option2: 0.025 cm
questions.option3: 0.35 cm
questions.option4: 0.025 mm
questions.description:
Solution: Because Least count = MSD - VSD



... Least count = (5 - 4.75) × 10-4 = 0.025 mm
